sources.title: The Swimmer (1968) Burt Lancaster Â· Janice Rule
sources.description: An aging bachelor escapes his everyday life and visits a number of former friends, testing out their swimming pools. However, this playful experiment with his own past leads to humiliation, disillusionment, and renewed loneliness.... An allegorical film fable that uses the figure of a homeless wanderer to demonstrate the narrow-mindedness of the well-off American middle class. However, the ambitious content and form sometimes result in kitschy pathos and pretentious symbolism.

metadata.Plot: Neddy Merrill has been away for most of the Summer. He reappears at a friend's pool. As they talk, someone notices that there are pools spanning the entire valley. He decided to jog from pool to pool to swim across the whole valley. As he stops in each pool his interactions tell his life story.
metadata.Actors: Burt Lancaster, Janet Landgard, Janice Rule
